channel.title: Functional Programming on Wu Sun, Ph.D.
channel.description: Recent content in Functional Programming on Wu Sun, Ph.D.

item.title: The Sieve of Eratosthenes in Haskell: A naive implementation
item.description: I have been learning Haskell for a while. The more I am exposed to this language, the more I am amazed by the elegance of the functional programming paradigm. List comprehension is one of the beautiful things that I like in Haskell. Coming from Python, I am familiar with it. But the list comprehension in Haskell feels more natural because it is closer to what you would write in mathematics.
